quiz.title: Two-Step Inequality Solving
quiz.subtitle: Unit 6 Quiz 4: Solving Inequalities Requiring Two Operations
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving Inequalities with Addition/Subtraction then Multiplication/Division

questions.question: Solve: $3x + 7 > 16$
questions.explanation: Subtract 7: $3x > 9$. Divide by 3: $x > 3$. No flip (dividing by positive).

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{y}{4} - 2 ≤ 5$
questions.explanation: Add 2: $\frac{y}{4} ≤ 7$. Multiply by 4: $y ≤ 28$. No flip (multiplying by positive).

questions.question: Solve: $-2m + 5 ≥ 13$
questions.explanation: Subtract 5: $-2m ≥ 8$. Divide by -2: $m ≤ -4$. FLIP when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $8 - 3n < 20$
questions.explanation: Subtract 8: $-3n < 12$. Divide by -3: $n > -4$. FLIP when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $5 - 2x ≤ -3$
questions.explanation: Subtract 5: $-2x ≤ -8$. Divide by -2: $x ≥ 4$. FLIP when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $-4(k - 2) ≥ 12$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $-4k + 8 ≥ 12$. Subtract 8: $-4k ≥ 4$. Divide by -4: $k ≤ -1$. FLIP when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{4 - p}{3} ≤ -2$
questions.explanation: Multiply by 3: $4 - p ≤ -6$. Subtract 4: $-p ≤ -10$. Multiply by -1: $p ≥ 10$. FLIP when multiplying by negative.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You handle two-step inequalities perfectly, including the critical flip rule with negative coefficients.
scoreMessages.70: Strong skills! Watch for: 1) Variables on right side (like 5 - 2x), 2) Negative coefficients after first step, 3) Fractions as coefficients.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice order: 1) Add/subtract to isolate variable term, 2) Multiply/divide to solve, 3) FLIP if multiplying/dividing by negative.
scoreMessages.0: Start by isolating the variable term (add/subtract), then isolate the variable (multiply/divide). REMEMBER: Flip inequality if multiplying/dividing by negative.
